RelatedSentence: The biggest selloff of Dubai stocks in nine months is failing to deter Schroders Plc and Shuaa Asset Management from seeing further gains in the world 's best - performing stock market .
The benchmark DFM General Index slumped 5.5 percent yesterday , taking its drop to 8.7 percent in the three days since MSCI Inc .
Stocks on the measure , the world 's third most - volatile index , traded at a peak of 19.1 times projected 12 - month earnings on May 14 , a 77 percent premium to developing - nation peers .

The DFM has more than doubled in value in the past 12 months , beating 92 global benchmarks tracked by Bloomberg , on bets the MSCI upgrade would lure investors managing about $ 8 trillion in assets who monitor the index provider 's gauges .

Emaar Properties PJSC ( EMAAR ) , developer of the world 's tallest skyscraper in Dubai , and Dubai Islamic Bank PJSC ( DIB ) were among nine United Arab Emirates companies that will join the MSCI Emerging Markets Index in the revamp .
The MSCI reclassification may attract more than $ 905 million to stocks in the U.A.E. , the second - largest Arab economy , HSBC Holdings Plc said in a note to investors last week .

Emaar , whose shares are up 38 percent this year , slid 6.3 percent yesterday , while Dubai Islamic lost 6.2 percent , the most since Aug .
Price swings in Dubai 's gauge were the third - highest after Vietnam and Greece yesterday among 72 indexes monitored by Bloomberg .
More than 80 percent of listed companies in the emirate that have reported first - quarter results showed stronger earnings , according to data compiled by Bloomberg .
